snippet: The White House and Congress cannot seem to agree on the first measures that would replace the automatic spending cuts and tax increases that make up the “fiscal cliff.”
abstract: Pres Obama and House speaker John A Boehner want Congress to approve first installment on deficit reduction in coming weeks, which would replace automatic spending cuts and tax increases that make up the 'fiscal cliff.'
lead_paragraph: The White House and Congress cannot seem to agree on the first measures that would replace the automatic spending cuts and tax increases that make up the “fiscal cliff.”

headline.seo: Deficit Talks Stumble Over Down Payment
headline.main:
Initial Deficit Cuts Are Sticking Point in
Negotiations
headline.print_headline: First Installment on Deficit Reduction a Sticking Point
